headline: Why The Equifax (EFX) Story Is Shifting As Analysts Reassess Growth And Risks
summary: Equifax’s fair value estimate has been trimmed to US$238.55 from US$243.15, a small reset that still sits just below at least one bank’s reinstated US$250 price target. That spread reflects the split you are seeing in recent research, with some analysts focusing on long term earnings potential and others placing more emphasis on near term risks and the valuation reset. Read on to see what is driving those views and how you can track the story as it evolves. Stay updated as the Fair Value for...

headline: Equifax Board of Directors Authorizes 12% Dividend Increase
summary: Equifax® (NYSE: EFX) today announced that the Equifax Board of Directors approved a 12% increase in the Company's quarterly cash dividend for the first quarter of 2026. The new quarterly cash dividend is $0.56 per share, subject to future declaration by the Company's Board of Directors. For the first quarter of 2026, the cash dividend of $0.56 per share is payable on March 17, 2026 to shareholders of record as of the close of business on March 9, 2026.
